metadata.name: Ensure that the --root-ca-file argument is set as appropriate (Automated)
metadata.description: Allow pods to verify the API server's serving certificate before establishing connections.
metadata.rationale: Processes running within pods that need to contact the API server must verify the API server's serving certificate. Failing to do so could be a subject to man-in-the-middle attacks. Providing the root certificate for the API server's serving certificate to the controller manager with the `--root-ca-file` argument allows the controller manager to inject the trusted bundle into pods so that they can verify TLS connections to the API server.
metadata.audit:
Run the following command on the control plane node:
```
ps -ef | grep kube-controller-manager
```
Verify that the `--root-ca-file` argument exists and is set to a certificate bundle file
containing the root certificate for the API server's serving certificate.
metadata.remediation:
Edit the Controller Manager pod specification file
`/etc/kubernetes/manifests/kube-controller-manager.yaml` 
on the control plane node and set the `--root-ca-file` parameter to
the certificate bundle file.
```
--root-ca-file=<path/to/file>
```
metadata.impact: You need to setup and maintain root certificate authority file.
